Abstract: This study explores the intersection of adaptive control and reinforcement learning, with a focus on the development of optimal control strategies that can adapt to changing environments. By leveraging the principles of reinforcement learning, adaptive control systems can learn to optimize their performance in real-time, leading to improved stability and robustness. The research investigates the application of reinforcement learning algorithms to adaptive control systems, with a particular emphasis on the trade-offs between optimality and stability. Experimental results demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach in achieving optimal control performance while maintaining stability and robustness. The findings of this study have significant implications for the development of adaptive control systems in complex, dynamic environments, and highlight the potential of reinforcement learning to improve the performance of adaptive control systems. The results also provide a foundation for future research into the application of reinforcement learning to other control systems.
